DOC.brief_summary: This second phase study design determine immunological effect long-term exercise risk factor ischemic heart disease ( phase 1 ) osteoporosis ( phase 2 ) . The result indicate six month moderate intensity exercise reduce bone resorption increase secretion anti-osteoclastogenic cytokine peripheral blood mononuclear cell .
DOC.brief_title: Exercise Modulator Immunological Risk Factors Osteoporosis
DOC.detailed_description: In trial involve 43 healthy adult investigator measure effect six month supervise exercise spontaneous phytohemagglutinin-induced production osteoclastogenic cytokine ( interleukin-1α , tumor necrosis factor-α ) , anti-osteoclastogenic cytokine ( transform growth factor-β , interleukins 4 and10 ) , pleiotropic cytokine variable effect osteoclastogenesis ( interferon-γ , interleukin-6 ) , T cell growth differentiation factor ( interleukins 2 12 ) peripheral blood mononuclear cell . The investigator also measure lymphocyte phenotype , serum marker bone formation ( osteocalcin ) , bone resorption ( C-terminal telopeptides Type I collagen ) , bone homeostasis ( estradiol , vitamin D2 , testosterone , parathyroid hormone , insulin-like growth factor ) .
DOC.criteria: Normal exercise treadmill test Any medical condition would prevent participation six month exercise program
